Ok, find out which one, then is some terminal calls, ,, one moment..
Ok, thanks
It is either lspci or lsusb, that will show what the version of it is as installed.
After you get an output from that command, you will know what drivers to install.

Yes, after getting the correct data from the ls output, then is pretty basic, search ralink in synaptic, but here is the warning, match the output of the lspci/lsusb with the proper available driver and is off to the races.
I see, thanks you very much for your help
